LoadAndSaveData.load_energy_weather_data.load_ts()[source]¶

Loads a set of time series and returns the cell array of ts structres. :param dirname: [string] named of folder with the loaded data. :return: time series, namedtuple tsStruct

LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series module¶

LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series.load_all_time_series(datasets=None, load_funcs=None, name_pattern='', load_raw=True)[source]¶

% Data loader % Input: datasets - cell array, contains names of the folders inside data/ % directory % % Output: a cell array of ts structures % Description of the time series structure: % t [T,1] - Time in milliseconds since 1/1/1970 (UNIX format) % x [T, N] - Columns of the matrix are time series; missing values are NaNs % legend {1, N} - Time series descriptions ts.x, e.g. ts.legend={?Consumption, ?Price?, ?Temperature?}; % nsamples [1] - Number of samples per time series, relative to the target time series % deltaTp [1] - Number of local historical points % deltaTr [1] - Number of points to forecast % readme [string] - Data information (source, formation time etc.) % dataset [string] - Reference name for the dataset % name [string] - Reference name for the time series % Optional: % type [1,N] (optional) Time series types ts.x, 1-real-valued, 2-binary, k ? k-valued % timegen [T,1]=func_timegen(timetick) (optional) Time ticks generator, may % contain the start (or end) time in UNIX format and a function to generate the vector t of the size [T,1]

LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series.load_raw_data(load_funcs)[source]¶

LoadAndSaveData.write_data_to_iot_format.from_iot_to_struct(ts_list, idx, dataset)[source]¶
